journal-title-group.journal-title: Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics

publisher.publisher-name: American Statistical Association, Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and Interface Foundation of North America

title-group.article-title: Estimating Frailty Models via Poisson Hierarchical Generalized Linear Models

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2003 American Statistical Association, Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and Interface Foundation of North America

abstract.p: Frailty models extend proportional hazards models to multivariate survival data. Hierarchical-likelihood provides a simple unified framework for various random effect models such as hierarchical generalized linear models, frailty models, and mixed linear models with censoring. We review the hierarchical-likelihood estimation methods for frailty models. Hierarchical-likelihood for frailty models can be expressed as that for Poisson hierarchical generalized linear models. Frailty models can thus be fitted using Poisson hierarchical generalized linear models. Properties of the new methodology are demonstrated by simulation. The new method reduces the bias of maximum likelihood and penalized likelihood estimates.
